title: Inkscape 1.3 Is Out With New Shape Builder Tool, Many Changes
description:
Inkscape 1.3 introduces a new tool called Shape Builder, which lets you create new shapes by combining and building new paths.

The post Inkscape 1.3 Is Out With New Shape Builder Tool, Many Changes appeared first on Linux Today.

title: Juno Tab 2 Ships With Debian, Ubuntu, Manjaro, Mobian
description:
Juno Tab 2, a Linux-powered tablet with an 11″ screen and Intel N5100 CPU is now available for pre-order. The price starts at $525.

The post Juno Tab 2 Ships With Debian, Ubuntu, Manjaro, Mobian appeared first on Linux Today.

title: Shotwell 0.32.2 Adds Support for HEIF Files With .HIF Extension
description:
The most significant change in Shotwell 0.32.2 is support for HEIF image files with the .HIF extension. Learn more here.

The post Shotwell 0.32.2 Adds Support for HEIF Files With .HIF Extension appeared first on Linux Today.

title: BlackBox 0.14.0 Brings Fresh Look and Powerful Features
description:
Unveiling Black Box 0.14.0 — with a fresh look and powerful features for Linux users and terminal lovers which brings some cool updates.

The post BlackBox 0.14.0 Brings Fresh Look and Powerful Features appeared first on Linux Today.

title: Debian 12.1 Released With 89 Bug Fixes, 26 Security Updates
description:
Debian 12.1 includes all the security and software updates that have been released since June 10, 2023. Learn more here.

The post Debian 12.1 Released With 89 Bug Fixes, 26 Security Updates appeared first on Linux Today.

title: Firefox 116 Will Add HW Accelerated Video Playback for Raspberry Pi 4
description:
Firefox 116 kicks off work on implementing hardware-accelerated H.264 video decoding on Linux for the AArch64 (ARM64) hardware architecture.

The post Firefox 116 Will Add HW Accelerated Video Playback for Raspberry Pi 4 appeared first on Linux Today.

title: Bad News for Open Source: EU Approves Cyber Resilience Act
description:
Open-source organizations are saying that if the Cyber Resilience Act passes, it will do damage to open source, both in Europe and globally.

The post Bad News for Open Source: EU Approves Cyber Resilience Act appeared first on Linux Today.

title: Proton 8.0-3 Is Out With Support for More Windows Games
description:
As expected, Proton 8.0-3 is here with support for more Windows games to play on your Linux system. Learn more here.

The post Proton 8.0-3 Is Out With Support for More Windows Games appeared first on Linux Today.
